faqs.question: What is the typical security deposit required when renting a flat in sector 38
faqs.answer: The standard practice for a Flat For Rent in sector 38 Gurugram usually requires a security deposit equivalent to two months of the agreed-upon rent. However this can vary depending on the property owner and the specific apartment complex. For highly furnished apartments or premium luxury units the landlord might request up to three months' rent as a deposit. This deposit is refundable at the end of the tenancy period provided there is no damage to the property beyond normal wear and tear and all utility bills are settled properly. Always confirm the exact deposit amount and refund conditions in the rental agreement.

faqs.question: Are utility bills included in the monthly rent for flats in sector 38
faqs.answer: Generally utility bills such as electricity water gas and internet are not included in the standard monthly rent for a Flat For Rent in sector 38. Tenants are typically responsible for paying these consumption charges directly to the respective service providers. Some serviced apartments might include basic utilities but this must be explicitly stated in the rental contract. It is highly advisable to clarify which utilities are the tenant's responsibility and whether any fixed charges apply before finalizing the lease.

faqs.question: What are the common lease durations available for rental properties in sector 38
faqs.answer: The most common lease duration for residential flats for rent in sector 38 Gurugram is twelve months. Landlords prefer this period for stability and reduced turnover costs. Some landlords may consider six-month leases but this is less frequent and might involve a slightly higher rental rate. If you require a shorter lease term such as three to six months you should specifically look for serviced apartments or properties catering to temporary stays as traditional residential leases are strongly focused on the annual contract.

faqs.question: How soon can I move into a Flat For Rent in sector 38 after signing the lease
faqs.answer: If the flat is vacant and ready for occupancy you can usually move in immediately after the lease agreement is formally signed and the security deposit and first month's rent are transferred. For unfurnished flats the move-in process is usually faster while furnished flats might require a day or two for final inventory checks. We prioritize fast transitions for all our tenants.

faqs.answer: The general rule in sector 38 and across Gurugram is that major structural repairs and maintenance of external building features or common areas are the landlord's responsibility.
